01964             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
01965         if nargs == 1:
01966             ax.set(title=str(args[0]))
01967         else:
01968             raise TypeError, "title: wrong number of arguments"
01969         
01970         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
01971             self._replot_replot()
01972

02014         
02015     # 2D Plotting
02016     def plot(self, *args, **kwargs):
02017         """Draw line and scatter plots. 
02018  
02019             - plot(y)
02020               plots values in 'y' on y-axis (same as plot(range(len(y)),y) )  
02021  
02022             - plot(x, y)
02023               plots 'y' against 'x', i.e. if 'x' and 'y' are vectors of
02024               length n, then this will plot all the points (x[i], y[i])
02025               for 0<=i<n. 
02026  
02027             - plot(y, fmt)
02028               plots values in 'y' on y-axis formated like fmt (see below).
02029  
02030             - plot(x1,y1,fmt1, x2,y2,fmt2, ...)
02031               same as hold(1) followed by multiple plot(x,y,fmt).
02032  
02033             - plot(x1,y1,x2,y2,...)
02034               like above, but automatically chooses different colours.
02035                 
02036             - plot(y1,...,x=x)
02037               uses 'x' as the x values for all the supplied curves.
02038               x='auto' has the same effect as x=range(len(y1)).
02039  
02040             - plot(...,log='x'), plot(...,log='xy') etc.
02041               draw logarithmic axes.
02042 
02043             - plot(...)
02044               returns a list a of all Line objects created.
02045             
02046  
02047         the following format specifiers exist:
02048  
02049             y     yellow        .     point              -     solid
02050             m     magenta       o     circle             :     dotted
02051             c     cyan          x     x-mark             -.    dashdot 
02052             r     red           +     plus               --    dashed   
02053             g     green         *     star
02054             b     blue          s     square
02055             w     white         d     diamond
02056             k     black         v     triangle (down)
02057                                 ^     triangle (up)
02058                                 <     triangle (left)
02059                                 >     triangle (right)
02060                                 p     pentagram
02061                                 h     hexagram
02062  
02063         Examples:
02064         
02065         draws a line
02066         >>> plot([1,2,3])
02067  
02068         draws 3 red 'x'
02069         >>> plot([1,2,3], 'rx')
02070  
02071         Note: loglog, semilogy, semilogx are like plot(...,log='xy'),
02072         plot(...,log='y') and plot(...,log='x').
02073         """
02074         kwargs['description'] = 'plot: 2D curve plot'
02075         ax = self.gcagca()
02076         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02077             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02078 
02079         if len(args) == 0:
02080             raise TypeError, "plot: not enough arguments given"
02081         
02082         legendcounter=len(ax.get('plotitems')) # Used for telling how many lines were added
02083         lines = [] # store all Line instances here
02084         # If first argument is a format string this will be ignored
02085         # If two format strings are used only the first of them will be used
02086         if 'x' in kwargs:   
02087             nargs = len(args)
02088             for i in range(len(args)-1):
02089                 if not isinstance(args[i], str):
02090                     if isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02091                         lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02092                                           y=args[i],
02093                                           format=args[1+i]))
02094                     else:
02095                         lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02096                                           y=args[i],
02097                                           format=''))
02098                         if i == nargs-2: 
02099                             lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02100                                               y=args[i+1],
02101                                               format=''))
02102         else: # Normal case
02103             # If an odd number, larger than 2, of non-strings in args are
02104             # between two string arguments, something is wrong.
02105             # If the odd number is one, the argument x='auto' is passed.
02106             nargs = len(args)
02107             i = 0
02108             if nargs in (1,2):
02109                 if not isinstance(args[0], str):
02110                     if nargs == 1:
02111                         lines.append(Line(x='auto',
02112                                           y=args[0],
02113                                           format=''))
02114                     else:
02115                         if not isinstance(args[1], str):
02116                             lines.append(Line(x=args[0],
02117                                               y=args[1],
02118                                               format=''))
02119                         else:
02120                             lines.append(Line(x='auto',
02121                                               y=args[0],
02122                                               format=args[1]))
02123                     i+100 #return
02124                 else:
02125                     raise Exception, "Can't plot a formatstring"
02126                 
02127             while i <= nargs-3:
02128                 # This item is not string --> y-value, should never be string.
02129                 if not isinstance(args[i], str):
02130                     if not isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02131                         if isinstance(args[i+2], str):
02132                             lines.append(Line(x=args[i],
02133                                               y=args[i+1],
02134                                               format=args[i+2]))
02135                             i = i+3
02136                         else:
02137                             lines.append(Line(y=args[i+1],
02138                                               x=args[i],
02139                                               format=''))
02140                             i = i+2
02141 
02142                     # Next element is str --> no x-value
02143                     else:
02144                         lines.append(Line(y=args[i],
02145                                           x='auto',
02146                                           format=args[i+1]))
02147                         i = i+2
02148                     # These last cases could be run outside the while loop
02149                     if i == nargs-2: # Either y and format or x and y value left   
02150                         if isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02151                             lines.append(Line(y=args[i],
02152                                               x='auto',
02153                                               format=args[i+1]))
02154                         else:
02155                             lines.append(Line(x=args[i],
02156                                               y=args[i+1],
02157                                               format=''))
02158                     elif i == nargs-1: # In this case we have only an y value left
02159                         lines.append(Line(y=args[i],
02160                                           x='auto',
02161                                           format=''))
02162 
02163         # add the lines to the axes in ax:
02164         ax.add(lines)
02165     
02166         # Set legends
02167         if 'legend' in kwargs:
02168             # Number of new lines
02169             legendcounter = len(ax.get('plotitems'))-legendcounter
02170             legends = kwargs['legend']
02171             if isinstance(legends, (tuple,list)): # legends is a sequence
02172                 if len(legends) == legendcounter:
02173                     for i in range(legendcounter):
02174                         legend = legends[legendcounter-i-1]
02175                         if isinstance(legend, str):
02176                             ax.get('plotitems')[-1-i].set(legend=legend)
02177                         else:
02178                             print "Legend "+legend+" is not a string"
02179                 else:
02180                     print """Number of legend items is not equal to number \
02181                     of lines in plotcommand"""
02182             elif isinstance(legends,str): # only one legend
02183                 ax.get('plotitems')[-1].set(legend=legends)
02184 
02185         if not ax.get('hold') and not 'box' in kwargs:
02186             kwargs['box'] = True
02187         ax.set(**kwargs)
02188         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02189         self.setset(**kwargs)
02190 
02191         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02192             self._replot_replot()
02193             
02194         return lines
02195 
02196     def loglog(self, *args, **kwargs):
02197         """Log-log scale plot.
02198 
02199         - loglog(...) is the same as plot(...) except that a logarithmic
02200           scale is used for both the x- and y-axis."""
02201         kwargs['log'] = 'xy'
02202         return self.plotplot(*args, **kwargs)
02203 
02204     def semilogx(self, *args, **kwargs):
02205         """Semi-log scale plot.
02206 
02207         - semilogx(...) is the same as plot(...) except that a logarithmic
02208           scale is used for the x-axis."""
02209         kwargs['log'] = 'x'
02210         return self.plotplot(*args, **kwargs)
02211 
02212     def semilogy(self, *args, **kwargs):
02213         """Semi-log scale plot.
02214 
02215         - semilogy(...) is the same as plot(...) except that a logarithmic
02216           scale is used for the y-axis."""
02217         kwargs['log'] = 'y'
02218         return self.plotplot(*args, **kwargs)    
02219             
02220     def plot3(self, *args, **kwargs):
02221         """Draw lines and points in 3D space.
02222  
02223             - plot3(x, y, z)
02224               plots 'z' against 'x' and 'y', i.e. if 'x', 'y', and 'z' are
02225               vectors of length n, then this will plot all the points
02226               (x[i], y[i], z[i]) for 0<=i<n. 
02227   
02228             - plot3(z)
02229               plots values in 'z' on x and y-axis
02230               (same as plot3(range(len(z)), range(len(z)), z))
02231 
02232             - plot3(z, fmt)
02233               plots values in 'z' on z-axis formated like fmt (see plot).
02234  
02235             - plot3(x1,y1,z1,fmt1, x2,y2,z2,fmt2, ...)
02236               same as hold(1) followed by multiple plot3(x,y,z,fmt).
02237  
02238             - plot3(x1,y1,z1,x2,y2,z2,...)
02239               like above, but automatically chooses different colours.
02240                 
02241             - plot3(z1,z2,...,x=x,y=y)
02242               uses 'x' as the x values and 'y' as the y values for all the
02243               supplied curves. x='auto' and y='auto' has the same effect as
02244               x=range(len(z1)) and y=range(len(z1)) respectively.
02245  
02246             - plot3(...)
02247               returns a list a of all created Line objects.
02248         """
02249         kwargs['description'] = 'plot3: 3D line plot'
02250         ax = self.gcagca()
02251         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02252             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02253 
02254         if len(args) == 0:
02255             raise TypeError, "plot3: not enough arguments given"
02256         
02257         legendcounter=len(ax.get('plotitems')) # can use len(lines) instead
02258         lines = [] # all Line instances are stored here
02259         
02260         # If first argument is a format string this will be ignored
02261         # If two format strings are used only the first of them will be used
02262         if 'x' in kwargs and 'y' in kwargs:
02263             nargs = len(args)
02264             for i in range(len(args)-1):
02265                 if not isinstance(args[i], str):
02266                     if isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02267                         lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02268                                           y=kwargs['y'],
02269                                           z=args[i],
02270                                           format=args[1+i]))
02271                     else:
02272                         lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02273                                           y=kwargs['y'],
02274                                           z=args[i],
02275                                           format=''))
02276                         if i == nargs-2: 
02277                             lines.append(Line(x=kwargs['x'],
02278                                               y=kwargs['y'],
02279                                               z=args[i+1],
02280                                               format=''))
02281         else: # Normal case
02282             # If an odd number, larger than 2, of non-strings in args are
02283             # between two string arguments, something is wrong.
02284             # If the odd number is one, the argument x='auto' is passed.
02285             nargs = len(args)
02286             i = 0
02287             if nargs in (1,2,3,4):
02288                 if not isinstance(args[0], str):
02289                     if nargs == 1: # plot3(z)
02290                         lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[0],
02291                                           format=''))
02292                     elif nargs == 2: # plot3(z,fmt)
02293                         if isinstance(args[1], str):
02294                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[0],
02295                                               format=args[1]))
02296                     elif nargs == 3: # plot3(x,y,z)
02297                         if not isinstance(args[2], str):
02298                             lines.append(Line(x=args[0], y=args[1], z=args[2],
02299                                               format=''))
02300                     else: # plot(x,y,z,fmt) or plot(z1,fmt1,z2,fmt2)
02301                         if not isinstance(args[3], str):
02302                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[0],
02303                                               format=args[1]))
02304                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[2],
02305                                               format=args[3]))
02306                         else:
02307                             lines.append(Line(x=args[0], y=args[1], z=args[2],
02308                                               format=args[3]))
02309                     i+100 #return
02310                 else:
02311                     raise ValueError, "plot3: can't plot a format string"
02312                 
02313             while i <= nargs-5:
02314                 if not isinstance(args[i], str): # should never be string
02315                     # cases:
02316                     # 1. plot3(x1,y1,z1,s1, x2,y2,z2,s2, ...)
02317                     if not isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02318                         if not isinstance(args[i+2], str):
02319                             if isinstance(args[i+3], str):
02320                                 lines.append(Line(x=args[i],
02321                                                   y=args[i+1],
02322                                                   z=args[i+2],
02323                                                   format=args[i+3]))
02324                                 i += 4
02325                             else:
02326                                 lines.append(Line(x=args[i],
02327                                                   y=args[i+1],
02328                                                   z=args[i+2],
02329                                                   format=''))
02330                                 i += 3
02331                     else: # next element is str --> no x and y values
02332                         lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[i],
02333                                           format=args[i+1]))
02334                         i += 2
02335                                               
02336                     # 2. plot3(x1,y1,z1, x2,y2,z2, ...)
02337                     # 3. plot3(z1,s1, z2,s2, ...)
02338 
02339                     if i == nargs-4:
02340                         if not isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02341                             lines.append(Line(x=args[i],
02342                                               y=args[i+1],
02343                                               z=args[i+2],
02344                                               format=args[i+3]))
02345                         else:
02346                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[i],
02347                                               format=args[i+1]))
02348                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[i+2],
02349                                               format=args[i+3]))
02350                     elif i == nargs-3: # x, y, and z left
02351                         lines.append(Line(x=args[i], y=args[i+1], z=args[i+2],
02352                                           format=''))
02353                     elif i == nargs-2: # only z and format string left   
02354                         if isinstance(args[i+1], str):
02355                             lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[i],
02356                                               format=args[i+1]))
02357                     elif i == nargs-1: # only a z value left
02358                         lines.append(Line(x='auto', y='auto', z=args[i],
02359                                           format=''))
02360 
02361         # add the lines to the axes in ax:
02362         ax.add(lines)
02363     
02364         # Set legends
02365         if 'legend' in kwargs:
02366             # Number of new lines
02367             #legendcounter = len(ax.get('plotitems'))-legendcounter
02368             legendcounter = len(lines)
02369             legends = kwargs['legend']
02370             if isinstance(legends, (tuple,list)): # legends is a sequence
02371                 if len(legends) == legendcounter:
02372                     for i in range(legendcounter):
02373                         legend = legends[legendcounter-i-1]
02374                         if isinstance(legend, str):
02375                             ax.get('plotitems')[-1-i].set(legend=legend)
02376                         else:
02377                             print "Legend "+legend+" is not a string"
02378                 else:
02379                     print """Number of legend items is not equal to number \
02380                     of lines in plotcommand"""
02381             elif isinstance(legends,str): # only one legend
02382                 ax.get('plotitems')[-1].set(legend=legends)
02383 
02384         if not ax.get('hold') and not 'view' in kwargs:
02385             kwargs['view'] = 3
02386         ax.set(**kwargs)
02387         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02388         self.setset(**kwargs)
02389 
02390         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02391             self._replot_replot()
02392             
02393         return lines
02394         
02395     
02396     def fill(self):
02397         """Draw filled 2D polygons."""
02398         raise NotImplementedError, "'fill' is not implemented"
02399  
02400     def quiver(self, *args, **kwargs):
02401         """Quiver plot.
02402         
02403         - quiver(X, Y, U, V)
02404           plots velocity vectors as arrows with components (u,v) at the
02405           points (x,y). The matrices X,Y,U,V must all be the same size and
02406           contain corresponding position and velocity components (X and Y
02407           can also be vectors to specify a uniform grid). 
02408 
02409         - quiver(U, V)
02410           plots velocity vectors at equally spaced points in the x-y plane.
02411           (same as quiver(range(m),range(n),U,V) )
02412 
02413         - quiver(..., 'filled')
02414           draw filled arrows
02415 
02416         - quiver(..., LineSpec)
02417           sets the line specification as given in LineSpec. 
02418 
02419         Examples:
02420 
02421         >>> xx, yy = meshgrid(seq(-2,2,.2))
02422         >>> zz = peaks(xx, yy)
02423         >>> contour(xx, yy, zz, 10, hold='on')
02424         >>> uu, vv = gradient(zz, .2)
02425         >>> quiver(xx, yy, uu, vv)
02426         """
02427         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02428             kwargs['description'] = 'quiver: 2D vector field'
02429         ax = self.gcagca()
02430         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02431             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02432         h = VelocityVectors(*args, **kwargs)
02433         ax.add(h)
02434         if not ax.get('hold'):
02435             if 'quiver3' in kwargs['description']:
02436                 if not 'grid' in kwargs:
02437                     kwargs['grid'] = True
02438                 if not 'view' in kwargs:
02439                     kwargs['view'] = 3
02440             else:
02441                 if not 'box' in kwargs:
02442                     kwargs['box'] = True
02443         ax.set(**kwargs)
02444         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02445         self.setset(**kwargs)
02446         
02447         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02448             self._replot_replot()
02449         return h
02450     
02451     def contour(self, *args, **kwargs):
02452         """Draw a 2D contour plot.
02453  
02454         - contour(X, Y, Z[, n])
02455           draw a contour plot were the values in the matrix 'Z' are treated
02456           as heights above a plane.
02457         
02458         - contour(Z[, n])
02459           same as contour(range(n), range(m), Z[, n]) were m,n = shape(Z).
02460         
02461         - contour(Z[, v])
02462           draw contours at levels specifyed in vector 'v'.
02463 
02464         - contour(..., LineSpec)
02465           sets the line specification as given in LineSpec.
02466 
02467         - contours(ax,...)
02468           use axis
02469           
02470         - contour(...,clabels='on')
02471           same as contour(...) followed by clabel('on')
02472         """
02473         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02474             kwargs['description'] = 'contour: 2D contours at base'
02475             
02476         ax = self.gcagca()
02477         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02478             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02479         h = Contours(*args, **kwargs)
02480         ax.add(h)
02481         if not ax.get('hold'):
02482             if 'contour3' in kwargs['description']:
02483                 if not 'grid' in kwargs:
02484                     kwargs['grid'] = True
02485                 if not 'view' in kwargs:
02486                     kwargs['view'] = 3
02487             else: # contour or contourf
02488                 if not 'box' in kwargs:
02489                     kwargs['box'] = True
02490         ax.set(**kwargs)
02491         if h.get('function') == 'contour3':
02492             ax.get('camera').set(view=3)
02493         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02494         self.setset(**kwargs)
02495 
02496         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02497             self._replot_replot()
02498         return h
02499 
02500     def contourf(self, *args, **kwargs):
02501         """Draw filled contour plot."""
02502         kwargs['description'] = 'contourf: 2D filled contour plot'
02503         return self.contourcontour(*args, **kwargs)
02504

02529     def streamline(self, *args, **kwargs):
02530         """Streamlines from 2D or 3D data.
02531 
02532         - streamline(X,Y,Z,U,V,W,STARTX,STARTY,STARTZ)
02533         - streamline(U,V,W,STARTX,STARTY,STARTZ)
02534           assumes X,Y,Z = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1), seq(p-1))
02535           where m, n, p = shape(U)
02536         ##- streamline(XYZ))
02537         - streamline(X,Y,U,V,STARTX,STARTY)
02538         - streamline(U,V,STARTX,STARTY)
02539           assumes X,Y = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1))
02540           where m, n = shape(U)
02541         - streamline(XY)
02542         - streamline(ax,...)
02543         - streamline(...,options)
02544           where options can be [stepsize]
02545         - h = streamline(...)
02546 
02547         Examples:
02548         """
02549         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02550             kwargs['description'] = "streamline: 2D or 3D streamline"
02551         
02552         ax = self.gcagca()
02553         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02554             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02555         h = Streams(*args, **kwargs)
02556         ax.add(h)
02557         ax.set(**kwargs)
02558         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02559         self.setset(**kwargs)
02560 
02561         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02562             self._replot_replot()
02563         return h
02564 
02565     def streamtube(self, *args, **kwargs):
02566         """3D stream tube.
02567 
02568         - streamtube(X,Y,Z,U,V,W,STARTX,STARTY,STARTZ)
02569         - streamtube(U,V,W,STARTX,STARTY,STARTZ)
02570           assumes X,Y,Z = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1), seq(p-1))
02571           where m, n, p = shape(U)
02572         ##- streamtube(VERTICES,X,Y,Z,DIVERGENCE)
02573         ##- streamtube(VERTICES,DIVERGENCE)
02574         ##- streamtube(VERTICES,WIDTH)
02575         ##- streamtube(VERTICES,width)
02576         ##- streamtube(VERTICES)
02577         - streamtube(...,[scale n])
02578         - streamtube(ax,...)
02579         - h = streamtube(...)
02580 
02581         Examples:
02582         """
02583         kwargs['description'] = "streamtube: 3D stream tube"
02584         return self.streamlinestreamline(*args, **kwargs)

02603     def mesh(self, *args, **kwargs):
02604         """Draw a 3D mesh surface.
02605 
02606         - mesh(X, Y, Z[, C])
02607           plots the colored parametric mesh defined in the four matrix
02608           arguments. The color scaling is determined by the range of C. Uses
02609           C = Z if C is not given, so color is proportional to mesh height.
02610             
02611         - mesh(Z[, C])
02612           same as mesh(range(n), range(m), Z[, C]) where m,n = shape(Z).
02613             
02614         - mesh(x, y, Z[, C])
02615           the two vector arguments must have len(x) == n and len(y) == m,
02616           where m,n = shape(Z)
02617 
02618         - mesh(ax, ...)
02619           plots into the Axis instance given in ax instead of the current axis.
02620 
02621         Example:
02622 
02623         >>> x = seq(-2,2,.2)
02624         >>> xx, yy = meshgrid(x)
02625         >>> zz = exp(-xx**2)*exp(-yy**2)
02626         >>> mesh(xx, yy, zz)
02627         """
02628         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02629             kwargs['description'] = 'mesh: 3D mesh'
02630             
02631         ax = self.gcagca()
02632         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02633             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02634         h = Surface(*args, **kwargs)
02635         ax.add(h)
02636         if not ax.get('hold'):
02637             if not 'grid' in kwargs:
02638                 kwargs['grid'] = True
02639             if not 'view' in kwargs:
02640                 kwargs['view'] = 3
02641         ax.set(**kwargs)
02642         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02643         self.setset(**kwargs)
02644         
02645         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02646             self._replot_replot()
02647         return h
02648 
02649     def meshc(self, *args, **kwargs):
02650         """Same as mesh(), but a contour plot is drawn beneath the mesh.
02651 
02652         Examples:
02653 
02654         Draw a mesh with contour lines:
02655         >>> x = seq(-2,2,.2)
02656         >>> xx, yy = meshgrid(x)
02657         >>> zz = peaks(xx, yy)
02658         >>> meshc(xx, yy, zz) 
02659 
02660         Draw a mesh with 20 contour lines:
02661         >>> meshc(xx, yy, zz, clevels=20)
02662 
02663         Draw a mesh with contour lines at height -0.2, -0.5, 0.2, 0.5:
02664         >>> meshc(xx, yy, zz, cvector=[-0.2,-0.5,0.2,0.5])
02665 
02666         Draw a mesh with contours and label the contours:
02667         >>> meshc(xx, yy, zz, clabels='on')
02668         """
02669         kwargs['description'] = 'meshc: 3D mesh with contours at base'
02670         return self.meshmesh(*args, **kwargs)
02671     
02672     def surf(self, *args, **kwargs):
02673         """Draw a 3D colored surface. See mesh() for documentation of input
02674         arguments.
02675 
02676         Examples:
02677 
02678         Draw a colored surface:
02679         >>> x = seq(-2,2,.2)
02680         >>> xx, yy = meshgrid(x)
02681         >>> zz = xx**2 + yy**2
02682         >>> surf(xx, yy, zz) 
02683         """
02684         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02685             kwargs['description'] = 'surf: 3D surface'
02686         return self.meshmesh(*args, **kwargs)
02687

02697     def quiver3(self, *args, **kwargs):
02698         """Draw velocity vectors in 3D.
02699         
02700         - quiver3(X, Y, Z, U, V, W)
02701         - quiver3(Z,U,V,W)
02702           assumes X, Y = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1)) where m,n = shape(Z)
02703         - quiver3(Z, U, V, W, s) or quiver3(X, Y, Z, U, V, W, s)
02704           scales the vectors by the scale factor given in s.
02705         - quiver3(..., 'filled')
02706           fills the arrows
02707         - quiver3(..., LineSpec)
02708           sets the specification on the arrows as given in LineSpec.
02709         - quiver3(ax, ...)
02710           draws the vectors in the Axis instance given in ax instead of
02711           the current axis.
02712         - h = quiver3(...)  
02713         """
02714         kwargs['description'] = "quiver3: 3D vector field"
02715         return self.quiverquiver(*args, **kwargs)

02724     # Volume plotting
02725     def slice_(self, *args, **kwargs):
02726         """Volumetric slice plot.
02727         
02728         - slice_(X,Y,Z,V,Sx,Sy,Sz)
02729 
02730         - slice_(X,Y,Z,V,XI,YI,ZI)
02731 
02732         - slice_(V,Sx,Sy,Sz) or slice_(V,XI,YI,ZI)
02733           same as slice_(seq(n), seq(m), seq(p)) where m,n,p = shape(V)
02734 
02735         - slice_(...,'method')
02736           'method' can be 'linear' (default), 'cubic', or 'nearest'.
02737 
02738         - slice(ax, ...)
02739           uses Axis instance in ax instead of the current axes.
02740 
02741         - h = slice(...)
02742 
02743         Examples:
02744 
02745         >>> xx, yy, zz = meshgrid(seq(-2,2,.2), seq(-2,2,.25), seq(-2,2,.16))
02746         >>> vv = x*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2)
02747         >>> slice_(xx, yy, zz, vv, [-1.2,.8,2], 2, [-2,-.2])
02748         """
02749         if not 'description' in kwargs:
02750             kwargs['description'] = 'slice_: volumetric slices'
02751         
02752         ax = self.gcagca()
02753         if len(args) > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02754             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:]
02755         h = Volume(*args, **kwargs)
02756         ax.add(h)
02757         if not ax.get('hold'):
02758             if 'slice_' in kwargs['description']:
02759                 if not 'grid' in kwargs:
02760                     kwargs['grid'] = True
02761                 if not 'view' in kwargs:
02762                     kwargs['view'] = 3
02763         ax.set(**kwargs)
02764         self.gcfgcf().set(**kwargs)
02765         self.setset(**kwargs)
02766 
02767         if (self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show')) or self.getget('show'):
02768             self._replot_replot()
02769         return h
02770 
02771     def contourslice(self, *args, **kwargs):
02772         """Contours in slice planes.
02773 
02774         - contourslice(X,Y,Z,V,SX,SY,SZ)
02775           draws contour in axis aligned x,y,z planes at the points in the
02776           arrays SX, SY, and SZ.
02777           
02778         - contourslice(X,Y,Z,V,XI,YI,ZI)
02779           draws contours through the volume V along the surface given in
02780           the arrays XI, YI, and ZI.
02781           
02782         - contourslice(V,SX,SY,SZ) or contourslice(V,XI,YI,ZI)
02783           assumes X,Y,Z = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1), seq(p-1))
02784           where m,n,p = shape(V).
02785           
02786         - contourslice(..., n)
02787           draws n contours per plane.
02788           
02789         - contourslice(..., cvals)
02790           draws len(cvals) contours per plane at levels given in cvals.
02791           
02792         - contourslice(ax,...)
02793           draws into the Axis instance given in ax instead of the current
02794           axes.
02795           
02796         - h = contourslice(...)
02797           returns con
02798         
02799         Example:
02800         xx, yy, zz = meshgrid(seq(-2,2,.2), seq(-2,2,.25), seq(-2,2,.16))
02801         vv = xx*exp(-xx**2-yy**2-zz**2); # Create volume data
02802         contourslice(xx, yy, zz, vv, [-.7,.7], [], [0], view=3)
02803         """
02804         kwargs['description'] = 'contourslice: contours in slice planes'
02805         return self.slice_slice_(*args, **kwargs)
02806

02835     def streamslice(self, *args, **kwargs):
02836         """Streamlines in slice planes.
02837         
02838         Example:
02839         xx,yy = meshgrid(seq(-3,3,.2))
02840         zz = peaks(xx,yy)
02841         surf(xx,yy,zz)
02842         shading('interp')
02843         hold('on')
02844         ch = contour3(xx,yy,zz,20);  ch.set(color='b')
02845         uu,vv = gradient(zz)
02846         h = streamslice(xx,yy,-uu,-vv); 
02847         h.set(color='k')
02848         for i in iseq(1,length(h); 
02849             zi = interp2(z,get(h(i),'xdata'),get(h(i),'ydata'));
02850             set(h(i),'zdata',zi);
02851         end
02852         view(30,50); axis tight
02853         """
02854         raise NotImplementedError, "'streamslice' is not implemented."
02855

02877         if not ax.get('hold') and not 'view' in kwargs:
02878             kwargs['view'] = 3

02884             self._replot_replot()

02889         self._replot_replot()

02891     def hidden(self, *args):
02892         """Toggle hidden line removal in the current axis.
02893 
02894         - hidden(state)
02895           state can be either 'on' or 'off'
02896 
02897         - hidden()
02898           toggles the hidden state.
02899         """
02900         ax = self.gcagca()
02901         nargs = len(args)
02902         if nargs == 1:
02903             ax.set(hidden=args[0])
02904         elif nargs == 0:
02905             ax.toggle('hidden')
02906         else:
02907             raise TypeError, "hidden: wrong number of arguments" 
02908         
02909         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
02910             self._replot_replot()
02911         
02912     def view(self, *args):
02913         """Specify viewpoint.
02914 
02915         - view(azimuth,elevation) or view([azimuth,elevation])
02916         
02917         - view(2)
02918           sets the view to the default 2D view.
02919             
02920         - view(3)
02921           sets the view to the default 3D view.
02922 
02923         - view(ax, ...)
02924           uses ax instead of the current axis.
02925         """
02926         ax = self.gcagca()
02927         nargs = len(args)
02928         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02929             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
02930 
02931         cam = ax.get('camera')
02932         # Allow both view(az,el) and view([az,el])
02933         if nargs == 1:
02934             if isinstance(args[0], (tuple,list)):
02935                 args = args[0]
02936             elif isinstance(args[0], (int,float)) and args[0] in (2,3):
02937                 cam.set(view=args[0])
02938                     
02939         if nargs == 2:
02940             cam.set(azimuth=args[0], elevation=args[1])
02941             
02942         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
02943             self._replot_replot()
02944 
02945     def camdolly(self, *args):
02946         """Dolly camera.
02947 
02948         - camdolly(dx, dy, dz)
02949           moves the camera position along the direction of projection.
02950 
02951         - camdolly(ax, ...)
02952           uses the Axis instance in ax instead of the current axes.
02953         """
02954         ax = self.gcagca()
02955         nargs = len(args)
02956         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02957             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
02958 
02959         cam = ax.get('camera')
02960         if nargs == 3:
02961             cam.set(camdolly=args)
02962         else:
02963             raise TypeError, "camdolly: wrong number of arguments"
02964         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
02965             self._replot_replot()

02967     def camlookat(self, *args):
02968         """Move camera and target to view specified objects.
02969 
02970         - camlookat(h)
02971           views the object in h, where h is a PlotProperties instance.
02972 
02973         - camlookat(ax)
02974           views objects in the Axis instance ax.
02975 
02976         - camlookat()
02977           views objects in the current axes.
02978         """
02979         ax = self.gcagca()
02980         nargs = len(args)
02981         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
02982             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
02983             
02984         if nargs == 0:
02985             self.gcagca().get('camera').set(camlookat=self.gcagca())
02986         elif nargs == 1:
02987             tmparg = args[0]
02988             if isinstance(tmparg, Axis):
02989                 tmparg.get('camera').set(camlookat=tmparg)
02990             elif isinstance(tmparg, PlotProperties):
02991                 self.gcagca().get('camera').set(camlookat=tmparg)
02992             else:
02993                 raise ValueError, \
02994                       "camlookat: object must be either %s or %s, not %s" % \
02995                       (type(Axis), type(PlotProperties), type(tmparg))
02996         else:
02997             raise TypeError, "camlookat: wrong number of arguments"
02998         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
02999             self._replot_replot()

03184     def camlight(self, *args, **kwargs):

03186

03188           creates a light in the current axes at the camera position.
03189

03191           creates a light right and up from the camera in the current axes.

03194           creates a light left and up from the camera.
03195

03197           same as camlight('right')
03198 
03199         - camlight(az, el)
03200           creates a light at az, el from the camera.
03201 
03202         - camlight(..., style)
03203           style can be either 'local' (default), or 'inifinite'.
03204 
03205         - camlight(h, ...)
03206           places Light instance h at the specified position.
03207 
03208         - h = camlight(...)
03209           returns light instance.
03210         """
03211         # should be implemented in backend
03212         raise NotImplementedError, "'camlight' not implemented in class %s" % \
03213               self.__class__.__name__

03215     def light(self, **kwargs):
03216         """Add a Light to the current axes.
03217 
03218         - light()
03219           adds a light with default values for all light properties.
03220 
03221         - light(param1=value1,param1=value2,...)
03222           adds a light with properties as given in the keyword arguments.
03223 
03224         - h = light(...)
03225           returns Light instance that was created.
03226         """
03227         l = Light(**kwargs)
03228         self.gcagca().set(light=l)
03229         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03230             self._replot_replot()
03231         return l

03233     def colormap(self, *args):
03234         """Specify colormap of the current figure.
03235 
03236         - colormap(map)
03237           sets the colormap in 'map' as the current colormap.
03238 
03239         - colormap('default')
03240           sets the colormap to the default colormap (jet).
03241 
03242         - colormap()
03243           returns the current colormap.
03244 
03245         - colormap(ax,...)
03246           sets the colormap in the axis 'ax' instead of the current axis.
03247         """
03248         ax = self.gcagca()
03249         nargs = len(args)
03250         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
03251             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
03252 
03253         if nargs == 1:
03254             if args[0] == 'default':
03255                 ax.set(colormap=self.jetjet())
03256             else:
03257                 ax.set(colormap=args[0]) # backend dependent
03258         elif nargs == 0:
03259             return ax.get('colormap')
03260         else:
03261             raise TypeError, "colormap: wrong number of arguments"
03262         
03263         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03264             self._replot_replot()
03265 
03266     def caxis(self, *args):
03267         """Pseudocolor axis scaling.
03268 
03269         - caxis([cmin, cmax]) or caxis(cmin, cmax)
03270           sets the pseudocolor axis scaling to range from 'cmin' to 'cmax'.
03271 
03272         - caxis('manual')
03273           fixes axis scaling at the current range.
03274             
03275         - caxis('auto')
03276           sets axis scaling back to autoranging.
03277 
03278         - caxis()
03279           returns the current axis scaling.
03280 
03281         - caxis(ax,...)
03282           uses the Axis instance in ax instead of the current axes.
03283         """
03284         ax = self.gcagca()
03285         nargs = len(args)
03286         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
03287             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
03288 
03289         if nargs == 0:
03290             return ax.get('caxis')
03291         elif nargs == 1:
03292             if isinstance(args[0], (tuple,list)):
03293                 args = args[0];  nargs = len(args)
03294             elif isinstance(args[0], str) and args[0] in ['auto', 'manual']:
03295                 ax.set(caxismode=args[0])
03296             else:
03297                 raise TypeError, "caxis: argument must be %s, not %s" % \
03298                       ((type(list),type(tuple),type(str)), type(args[0]))
03299 
03300         if nargs == 2:
03301             ax.set(caxis=args)
03302 
03303         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03304             self._replot_replot()
03305 
03306     def colorbar(self, *args):
03307         """Display color bar (color scale) and return the color bar.
03308 
03309         - colorbar()
03310           appends a colorbar to the current axes.
03311 
03312         - colorbar('off')
03313           removes the colorbar from the current axes.
03314 
03315         - colorbar(location)
03316           appends a colorbar to the current axes at location specified
03317           by 'location'. 'location' may be any of the following strings:
03318 
03319               'North'              inside plot box near top
03320               'South'              inside bottom
03321               'East'               inside right
03322               'West'               inside left
03323               'NorthOutside'       outside plot box near top
03324               'SouthOutside'       outside bottom
03325               'EastOutside'        outside right
03326               'WestOutside'        outside left
03327 
03328         - colorbar(ax,...)
03329           appends a colorbar to the Axis instance specified by ax' instead
03330           of the current axis.
03331 
03332         - h = colorbar(...)
03333           returns a Colorbar instance.
03334         """
03335         ax = self.gcagca()
03336         nargs = len(args)
03337         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
03338             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
03339 
03340         cbar = ax.get('colorbar')
03341         if nargs == 0:
03342             cbar.set(visible=True)
03343         elif nargs == 1:
03344             if args[0] == 'off' or not args[0]:
03345                 cbar.set(visible=False)
03346             else:
03347                 cbar.set(visible=True)
03348                 cbar.set(cblocation=args[0])
03349         else:
03350             raise TypeError, "colorbar: wrong number of arguments"
03351         
03352         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03353             self._replot_replot()
03354 
03355         return cbar
03356 
03357     def shading(self, *args):
03358         """Control the color shading of surfaces.
03359         
03360         - shading(mode)
03361           sets the shading of the current graph to the shading mode specified
03362           by 'mode'. Valid modes are 'flat', 'interp' (interpolated) and
03363           'faceted'.
03364 
03365         - shading(ax,...)
03366           uses axes 'ax' instead of the current axes.
03367         """
03368         ax = self.gcagca()

03370         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
03371             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
03372 
03373         if nargs == 1:
03374             ax.set(shading=str(args[0]))
03375         else:
03376             raise TypeError, "shading: wrong number of arguments" 
03377         
03378         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03379             self._replot_replot()
03380

03393     def box(self, *args):
03394         """Add or remove a box to the current axes.
03395 
03396         - box('on')
03397           adds a box to the current axes.
03398 
03399         - box('off')
03400           removes the box.
03401 
03402         - box()
03403           toggles box state of the current axes.
03404 
03405         - box(ax,...)
03406           uses axes in 'ax' instead of the current axes.
03407         """
03408         ax = self.gcagca()
03409         nargs = len(args)
03410         if nargs > 0 and isinstance(args[0], Axis):
03411             ax = args[0];  args = args[1:];  nargs -= 1
03412 
03413         if nargs == 0:
03414             ax.toggle('box')
03415         elif nargs == 1:
03416             ax.set(box=args[0])
03417         else:
03418             raise TypeError, "box: wrong number of argumnts"
03419         
03420         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03421             self._replot_replot()
03422 
03423     def material(self, *args):
03424         """Material reflectance mode.
03425 
03426         - material([ka, kd, ks[, n[, sc]]]) or material(ka, kd, ks[, n[, sc]])
03427           sets the ambient/diffuse/specular strength, specular exponent, and
03428           specular color reflectance.
03429 
03430         - material(mode)
03431           mode can be either 'shiny', 'dull', 'metal', or 'default'.
03432         """
03433         modes = {'shiny':   (None, None, None, None, None),
03434                  'dull':    (None, None, None, None, None),
03435                  'metal':   (None, None, None, None, None),
03436                  'default': (None, None, None, None, None),
03437                  }
03438         ka, kd, ks, n, sc = modes['default']
03439         nargs = len(args)
03440         if nargs == 1:
03441             if isinstance(args[0], (tuple,list)):
03442                 args = args[0]
03443                 nargs = len(args)
03444             elif args[0] in modes.keys():
03445                 ka, kd, ks, n, sc = modes[args[0]]
03446 
03447         if nargs >= 3:
03448             ka, kd, ks = args[:3]
03449         if nargs >= 4:
03450             n = args[3]
03451         if nargs == 5:
03452             sc = args[4]
03453         if nargs < 1 or nargs > 5:
03454             raise ValueError, "material: wrong nmumber of arguments"
03455 
03456         kwargs = {}
03457         if ka is not None: kwargs['ambient'] = ka
03458         if kd is not None: kwargs['diffuse'] = kd
03459         if ks is not None: kwargs['specular'] = ks
03460         if n is not None: kwargs['specularpower'] = n
03461         #if sc is not None: kwargs['specularcolorreflectance'] = sc
03462 
03463         ax = self.gcagca()
03464         items = ax.get('plotitems')
03465         for i in range(ax.get('numberofitems')):
03466             items[i].get('material').set(**kwargs)
03467 
03468         if self.getget('interactive') and self.getget('show'):
03469             self._replot_replot()
03470             
03471     def subvolume(self, *args):
03472         """Extract subset of volume dataset.
03473         
03474         - nx, ny, nz, nv = subvolume(x,y,z,v,limits)
03475         - nx, ny, nz, nv = subvolume(v,limits)
03476         - nx, ny, nz, nu, nv, nw = subvolume(x,y,z,u,v,w,limits)
03477           extracts subset of vector dataset u,v,w.
03478         - nx, ny, nz, nu, nv, nw = subvolume(u,v,w,limits)
03479         """
03480         u = None
03481         nargs = len(args)
03482         if nargs == 7: # subvolume(x,y,z,u,v,w,limits)
03483             x, y, z, u, v, w = [asarray(a) for a in args[:6]]
03484         elif nargs == 5: # subvolume(x,y,z,v,limits)
03485             x, y, z, v = [asarray(a) for a in args[:4]]
03486         elif nargs == 4: # subvolume(u,v,w,limits)
03487             u, v, w = [asarray(a) for a in args[:3]]
03488             try:
03489                 m, n, p = u.shape
03490             except:
03491                 raise ValueError, \
03492                       "subvolume: U must be 3D, not %dD" % len(u.shape)
03493             x, y, z = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1), seq(p-1))
03494         elif nargs == 2: # subvolume(v,limits)
03495             v = asarray(args[0])
03496             try:
03497                 m, n, p = v.shape
03498             except:
03499                 raise ValueError, \
03500                       "subvolume: V must be 3D, not %dD" % len(v.shape)
03501             x, y, z = meshgrid(seq(n-1), seq(m-1), seq(p-1))
03502         else:
03503             raise TypeError, "subvolume: wrong number of arguments"
03504 
03505         # get limits:
03506         try:
03507             xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax, zmin, zmax = args[-1]
03508         except:
03509             raise ValueError, "subvolume: limits must be given as %s" % \
03510                   ('xmin xmax ymin ymax zmin zmax'.split())
03511 
03512         # find indices in x, y, and z according to limits:
03513         # ...
03514 
03515         if u is not None: # vector data set
03516             assert x.shape == y.shape == z.shape == \
03517                    u.shape == v.shape == w.shape, \
03518                    "subvolume: all arrays must be of same shape"
03519             usub = u[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03520             vsub = v[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03521             wsub = w[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03522         else: # volume data set
03523             assert x.shape == y.shape == z.shape == v.shape, \
03524                    "subvolume: all arrays must be of same shape"
03525             vsub = v[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03526         
03527         xsub = x[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03528         ysub = y[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03529         zsub = z[xmin:xmax, ymin:ymax, zmin:zmax]
03530 
03531         if u is not None:
03532             return xsub, ysub, zsub, usub, vsub, wsub
03533         return xsub, ysub, zsub, vsub
03534 
03535     def reducevolume(self, *args):
03536         """Reduce volume dataset."""
03537         raise NotImplementedError, "'reducevolume' not implemented"
03538

03631 class DerivedClass(BaseClass):
03632     """Template for creating new backends."""
03633     
03634     def __init__(self):
03635         BaseClass.__init__(self)
03636         self.initinit()
03637         
03638     def init(self):
03639         # Set docstrings of all functions to the docstrings of BaseClass
03640         # The exception is if something is very different
03641         # Alex had a nice function for this.
03642 
03643         #Do initialization special for this backend
03644         pass
03645         
03646     def _replot(self):
03647         """
03648         Update backend
03649         """
03650         #Write backend specific plot commands
03651 
03652         # the old (easyplot) way:
03653         '''
03654         currentfignumber=self._attr('curfig')
03655         currentfig=self._figs{currentfignumber}
03656         1. set correct attributes in backend
03657 
03658         for line in currentfig.lines:
03659             2 check attributes of line
03660             3 plot data.
03661         
03662         '''
03663 
03664         # the new (easyviz) way:
03665         '''
03666         ax = self.gca() # the current axis
03667         1. set correct properties in backend for the current axis (like axis
03668            limits, camera view, box, grid, ...), and for the current figure
03669            (like window size, subplots, ...).
03670 
03671         for item in ax.get('plotitems'):
03672             2. check the kind of the item object (that is, if it is a Line
03673                instance, a Surface instance, ...) and act accordingly.
03674             3. plot data.
03675         '''
03676         pass
03677         
03678     def hardcopy(self, file='file.ps', **kwargs):
03679         """
03680         Save current figure to file
03681         """
03682         pass

03690 def use(plt, namespace=globals()):
03691     """Export the namespace of backend instance to namespace."""
03692     plt_dict = {}
03693     plt_dict['plt'] = plt
03694     for item in plt.__dict__:
03695         plt_dict[item] = eval('plt.'+item)                                   
03696     for item in dir(plt.__class__):
03697         if not '__' in item:  
03698             plt_dict[item] = eval('plt.'+item) 
03699     namespace.update(plt_dict)  # Add to global namespace 
03700 
03701     # If this module is imported
03702     try:
03703         __all__
03704     except:
03705         __all__ = ['plt']
03706     try:
03707         for item in plt_dict.keys():
03708             __all__.append(item)
03709     except:
03710         pass
03711     del(__all__)
03712 
03713         
03714 def debug(plt, level=10):
03715 
03716     def print_(item, spaces=10):
03717         """Indent print"""
03718         pref = ' '*spaces
03719         print pref+('\n'+pref).join((str(item)).split('\n'))
03720         
03721     print "plt:"
03722     print plt
03723     if level > 0:
03724         for fignr in plt._figs:
03725             print "\nFig %d:" % fignr
03726             fig = plt._figs[fignr]
03727             print fig
03728 
03729             if level > 1:
03730                 axes_ = fig.get('axes')
03731                 for axnr in axes_.keys():
03732                     print_("\nAx %d:" % axnr, 4)
03733                     ax = axes_[axnr]
03734                     print_(ax, 8)
03735 
03736                     if level > 2:
03737                         print_("\nCamera:", 4)
03738                         print_(ax.get('camera'), 8)
03739 
03740                         print_("\nColorbar:", 4)
03741                         print_(ax.get('colorbar'), 8)
03742 
03743                         print_("\nLights:", 4)
03744                         for light_ in ax.get('lights'):
03745                             print_(light_, 8)
03746 
03747                         print_("\nPlotitems:", 4)
03748                         for i, item in enumerate(ax.get('plotitems')):
03749                             print_('item number %s %s:' %(i, repr(item)), 8)
03750                             print_(item, 12)
03751                             
03752                             if level > 3:
03753                                 print_("Material:", 12)
03754                                 print_(item.get('material'), 16)
03755 
03756                             print ''
